tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

tweets.text: @dscriven @phil_wiffen One of the most useful ones I've done is using the @EnvAgency API. https://t.co/pzTNdYHLTa

While I'm building my ark, I thought I'd create another #CitrixWorkspace feed. This one is the @EnvAgency flood API data. Only took a few minutes to create with the #microapp builder. Needs a tidy up but it's useful already. Endless possibilities with this @CitrixWorkspace tool! https://t.co/6GmeRUnFPP
@dscriven @phil_wiffen Nothing wrong with that. That how it starts. You realise how easy it is to get something useful, then you go looking for more APIs. It's quite addictive.

Last year saw highest pollution incidents since 2014 and 4 of 9 water co’s were rated poor or requiring improvement.
This year the @EnvAgency halts water quality testing in May and attends only 3% of incidents.

#regulatoryfail
#UpShitCreek

https://t.co/XBxs7qZ2wW

tweets.text: @safepointapp @The_WMA @NorfolkNNSI @EnvAgencyAnglia @BroadsAuth My recollection - it grows blooming fast - think something like 10cm a day in high season (faster than bamboo perhaps?) - and it floats on the surface preventing sunlight getting to plants on the bottom (macrophages?) that are important habitats for all kinds of insects and fish.
@The_WMA @HuwSayer @NorfolkNNSI @EnvAgencyAnglia @BroadsAuth Nice work! Why does it need to be removed? –I'm guessing that it's bad for the ecosystem, but I don't know about the plant or its effects.

We're excited to announce our Love Your River Cole project has been awarded a £705,000 grant from the #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund. We're leading a partnership to help transform the Cole valley in the West Midlands.
@EnvAgencyMids #TogetherForOurPlanet @DefraGovUK, @HeritageFundUK https://t.co/dD1mXbEJf6
